title: Love you, Riot
body: I really love last reworks. I enjoy everytime I play nidalee, karma and skarner. And also when I play against them. I think you are doing a great work. I cannot wait next rework. (Karma is actually my favorite champion)

replies.body:
That's ultimately the goal of the champion update team (LET'S STOP CALLING THEM REWORKS AND LET'S CALL THEM CHAMPION UPDATES ALRIGHT) - creating more excitement for the champion while also addressing either unsatisfying or binary gameplay. 

I'll pass this appreciation along to the team (although they read these boards as well).
so what your telling us to do is stop calling them what they are called to what? soften the blow of the REWORK the champion just received?
That was more of a joke, feel free to be snarky if you'd like. We tend to call them champion updates is all.

imo updates are number tweaks or bug fixes not completely removing an older champion and putting in a new champion given an older champions name... if what i posted seems "snarky" well its because of the recent REWORKS have people like me bitter about "champion updates" some times you at riot keep SOME of what the champion use to be (like that rengar rework) or making a new champion and replacing the old one (skarner rework) in which case he STILL hasnt been "balanced" to either the community or rito's standards :| so... about that sona "update" aka rework.. hows that gonna go?

Since you guys make the cmapion updates For me Karma and Skarner are one of those who are the most op champs to play. I would say nerf but it's ok if the community doesn't want it..

PS: My Opinion =/= Your Opinion sorry about that....
Man, gotta love those reworks. Kappa

@Riot Pwyff

Can confirm, playing against nidalee is much less frustrating now. I usually play toplane and usually a ranged poke champion is really annoying to a toplaner, but I prefer facing this nidalee 100x more than the one before.
[leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Champion](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Champion) go there to see upcoming reworks :)
I will always remember when you would get hit by a Nidalee spear..... by walking parallel to it. Now me and the spears can co-exist.
I'm right there with you!  Most of the reworks end up in champions with better gameplay and counterplay, e.g. Nidalee no longer having spears that do 2500 damage and she's still strong.

Yes, I agree. I like playing Nida in toplane because if you play ad, she is good in early game, if you play ap, if good in late game. So I start to play Nidalee ad runes and masteries and I buy ap, CDR and health item. Have fun!
